Dear Yulonda Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Sincerely,
Vivian D Malleck, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There are staff members who are not breaking up fights between
youth.
Investigation Interviews
Left message for Complainant on 02/28/2025. Complainant was
interviewed on 03/05/2025 by phone. Complainant stated she
does not know the names of the staff that did not intervene in a
physical altercation between Youth A and another youth.
Youth A was interviewed on 03/04/2025 at Vista Maria. Youth A
stated it took staff five minutes to physically intervene when Youth
B started a physical altercation with her in the green common area
over a box of crayons. Youth A stated she ran out of Deroy Hall
when staff opened the kitchen door, pulled the fire alarm and went
to Myriam Hall. Youth A stated assistance was called but she
does not recall who responded or what they did. Youth A stated
Youth B pulled out a handful of Youth A’s hair and scratched
Youth A’s nose, the left side of her face and her arm. Youth A
stated the scratch marks have healed and were observed without
markings. Youth A stated she does not have further details.
Youth B was interviewed on 03/04/2025 at Vista Maria. Youth B
stated she asked Youth A not to play with her crayons and to
return the crayons to her. Youth B stated Youth A refused and
broke some of the crayons. Youth B stated Youth and Family
Specialist (YFS) and another female staff (does not recall who)
intervened when Youth A pushed Youth B and Youth B hit Youth
A in the face in self-defense. Youth B stated YFS called for
assistance and staff (does not recall who) came and separated
Youth A and Youth B. Youth B stated Youth A pulled the fire alarm
and ran to Myriam Hall and staff (does not recall who) ran after
her. Youth B stated she was not injured in this incident. Youth B
2

stated she had long nails and she may have scratched Youth A in
this incident.
Youth C was interviewed on 03/04/2025 at Vista Maria. Youth C
stated she did not witness a physical altercation between Youth A
and Youth B.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 04/08/2025 by phone at Vista Maria
with Vista Representative. Staff 1 stated Youth A asked Team
Lead 3 if she could make a phone call and Youth B interjected that
she was designated to make the first phone call based on the
phone call list. Staff 1 stated Youth A agreed and left the green
common area to allow Youth B privacy to call her aunt. Staff 1
stated Youth B completed her call and refused to leave the green
common area for Youth A to call her mother. Staff 1 stated Youth
A tried explaining to Youth B that her phone calls are on speaker
phone due to treatment needs. Staff 1 stated Youth A waited
patiently at the phone desk while Youth B continued to refuse
stating it was not her fault that Youth A’s phone calls were
supervised. Staff 1 stated Team Lead 2 arrived to talk with Youth
B and during this time Youth A took a crayon from the crayon box
on the phone desk and started to draw and scribble. Staff 1 stated
Youth B asked for the crayons and Youth A broke one. Staff 1
stated Youth B charged at Youth A and a physical altercation
started. Staff 1 stated she called for assistance and tried to
intervene but Youth A and Youth B had each other by their hair.
Staff 1 stated she tried to release Youth B’s hand from Youth A’s
hair. Staff 1 stated she and staff (does not recall who) stood
between and blocked Youth A and Youth B from each other once
they separated themselves. Staff 1 stated Youth A went to Myriam
Hall and Youth B was de-escalated by Staff 1 and another
(unidentified) staff. Staff 1 stated Youth A obtained a scratch on
her face in this incident.
Youth and Family Specialist (YFS) was interviewed on
04/08/2025 at Vista Maria with Vista Representative. YFS stated
she heard Youth B tell Youth A not to touch her crayons before
Youth A and Youth B began to hit each other. YFS stated she
called for assistance and moved the chairs away from Youth A
and Youth B until assistance staff arrived because additional staff
were needed to intervene with Youth A and Youth B’s physical
altercation. YFS stated staff (does not recall who) arrived and
Youth A and Youth B were separated without being physically
managed. YFS stated she does not recall if Youth A or Youth B
were injured in this incident.
3

Team Lead 1 (TL1) was interviewed on 04/08/2025 at Vista Maria
with Vista Representative. TL1 stated he responded to an
assistance call on Deroy Hall and found Youth B pulling Youth A’s
hair and Youth A swinging her arms at Youth B. TL1 stated Youth
A and Youth B were loudly arguing but does not recall what was
said. TL1 stated he and other staff (does not recall who) verbally
redirected Youth A and Youth B. TL1 stated he and Staff 1 tried to
stand one on each side of Youth B to separate her from Youth A
but does not recall further details. TL1 does not recall if Youth A or
Youth B was injured in this incident. TL1 does not recall what
happened once Youth A and Youth B separated.
Team Lead 2 (TL2) was interviewed on 04/08/2025 at Vista Maria
with Vista Representative. TL2 stated she did not recall much
about Youth A and Youth B’s physical altercation over crayons.
TL2 read over the incident report and stated she was not present
at the beginning of the incident but responded to the assistance
call. TL2 stated Youth A and Youth B were already separated
when she arrived. TL2 stated Former Staff followed Youth A to the
front of the Deroy Hall and does not recall further details. TL2
does not recall if Youth A and Youth B were injured in this
incident.
Team Lead 3 (TL3) was interviewed on 04/08/2025 at Vista Maria
with Vista Representative. TL3 stated Youth A truanted from
Deroy Hall to Myriam Hall and was followed by a staff (does not
recall who). TL3 stated Youth A was barefoot with some blood on
her face. TL3 stated Youth A and the staff sat at Myriam Hall while
TL3 went to Deroy Hall to follow up with the fire alarm and Youth
B. TL3 stated further assistance was not needed with Youth B
when he arrived and Youth B was not injured. TL3 stated Youth A
returned to Deroy Hall without incident.
A message was left for Former Staff on 04/09/2025. Another
attempt to interview Former Staff was made on 04/14/2025.
Former Staff’s last known number now belongs to someone else.
Video
02/13/2025 video footage of Deroy Hall green common area
shows the following. Video does not record sound.
20:02:00 Youth B stands and leans forward on a round circular
table facing Youth A’s direction. Youth A sits in a chair facing a
wall in a corner (desk cannot be seen).
20:02:31 Youth B walks over to Youth A and reaches for
something. Youth A pushes Youth B’s arm away. Youth A and
Youth B start hitting and pulling each other.
4

20:02:34 Staff 1 attempts to intervene from behind Youth B and
appears to verbally redirect.
20:02:43 TL2 opens the door to the green common area. FS1 and
TL1 follow TL2 into the green common area. Staff 1 and FS1
move towards Youth B and TL1 and TL2 move towards Youth A.
Staff try to separate Youth A and Youth B who are entangled with
hair pulling and arms swinging.
20:03:11 Youth A and Youth B separate. Staff 1 and TL1 guide
Youth B away from Youth A.
20:03:27 Youth A moves towards Youth B but staff immediately
surround Youth B or step between Youth A and Youth B. TL1
stands facing Youth A with her arms stretched out to her side to
prevent her approach and appears to verbally redirect.
20:03:40 Youth A exits the green common area.
02/13/2025 video footage of Myriam Hall shows Youth A and a
staff inside the front part of the building at 20:03:59.
Documentation
Incident report written by Staff 1 coincides with her interview.
02/14/2025 Youth A was seen by a nurse at Vista Maria for the
physical altercation with Youth B. Nursing note states Youth A has
a scratch on the bridge of her nose and on her left cheek without
bleeding or drainage. Youth A does not have bruising, pain or
other injuries.
Vista Maria utilizes Crisis Prevention Institute (CPI) – Nonviolent
Crisis Prevention Intervention. Staff involved with Youth A and
Youth B in this investigation and their last CPI training in relation
to the date of this incident are listed below.
Staff 1 had CPI training on 12/17/2024.
Youth and Family Specialist had CPI training on 07/25/2024.
Team Lead 1 had CPI training on 04/25/2024.
Team Lead 2 had CPI training on 03/16/2023. (See Rule
400.4159(1)(d) in this report.)
Team Lead 3 had CPI training on 09/24/2024.
Former Staff 1 had CPI training on 12/17/2024
Tour
Upon entering Deroy Hall, one stands in the orange common
area, which is furnished with couches. To the left is a full-service
kitchen separated by a door and multipurpose room also
separated by a door. Walking straight across the orange common
area and crossing through the doorway leads to the green
5

common area, which is furnished with couches and tables and
where the incident took place.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance in providing for the needs,
protection and supervision of Youth A. Youth B started an
unprompted physical altercation with Youth A on 02/13/2025 at
20:02:31. Staff 1 intervened at 20:02:34 and TL1, TL2 and FS
intervened at 20:02:43.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Incident reporting.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4150
Section (1) Any incident resulting in serious injury of a resident or illness
Description requiring inpatient hospitalization, shall be reported to the parent/
legal guardian, responsible referring agency, and the licensing
authority as soon as possible, but not more than 24 hours after the
incident.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff members are not reporting to parents significant incidents
which occur at the facility.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 03/05/2025 by phone.
Complainant received explanation of R 400.4150 (1)(2)(3)(4).
Complainant did not have concerns following the explanation.
Youth A was interviewed on 03/04/2025 at Vista Maria. Youth A
stated she truanted on 11/30/2025 from Vista Maria and her
mother was not notified. Youth A stated she headed east on
Warren Road and a staff (did not state who) picked her up
approximately 30 minutes later.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 04/09/2025 by phone. Staff 2 stated a
youth’s parent is notified when a youth truants from Vista Maria
and this contact is documented on a form. Staff 2 stated she
spoke with Youth A’s Mother when Youth A truanted from Deroy
Hall sometime in 11/2024 and documented the contact.
Documentation
11/30/2024 incident report states Youth A pulled the fire alarm,
pushed past staff and truanted at 11:15 PM from Deroy Hall. It
6

states law enforcement returned Youth A to campus
approximately an hour later.
Vista Maria’s Parent/Legal Guardian Debriefing Form dated
11/30/2024 states Staff 2 contacted Youth A’s mother by phone at
11:50 PM for Youth A’s truancy from Deroy Hall. Staff 2 initialed
the contact and wrote “yes” in the prompt box titled “Call
Completed”.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as Complainant no longer had
concerns after discussing the rule. Youth A alleged her mother
was not notified of her 11/30/2024 truancy from Deroy Hall but
Staff 2’s interview and documentation lean towards contact was
made.
CONSULTATION
The prompt box titled “Call Completed” should differentiate if a
message was left or if actual contact occurred.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTBALISHED
Rule Code Health services; policies and procedures.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(e) Dispensing medication.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff at the facility are giving out incorrect medications. Giving one
youth another youth's medication.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 03/05/2025 by phone.
Complainant stated Youth A took another youth’s morning
medication in 12/2024 without realizing it until later because she
was “groggy” in the morning.
Youth A was interviewed on 03/04/2025 at Vista Maria. Youth A
stated staff (does not recall who) gave her Youth D’s morning
medication in 12/2024 or 01/2025. Youth A stated she took three
to four pills and ate fiber cookies before realizing it was not her
medication because she is not prescribed fiber cookies. Youth A
stated the staff that gave her the wrong medication said, “oops my
7

bad” when Youth A told her. Youth A stated she did not have side
effects and did not follow up with a nurse or doctor.
Youth D was interviewed on 04/08/2025 at Vista Maria. Youth D
was asked if there was a medication error between her and Youth
A. Youth D stated a newly hired staff (does not recall staff’s name)
gave Youth D’s morning fiber cookie to Youth A sometime in
12/2024 or 01/2025 and this staff may have also given Youth D’s
morning medication to Youth A. Youth D stated she did not
recognize the pills that were given to her and she told this to the
staff. Youth D stated this staff told her the medication was correct
but Youth D refused to take the pills. Youth D stated she does not
recall what morning medication she was on when this occurred
because her prescribed medications frequently changes. Vista
Representative was called in to the interview room with Youth D’s
permission. Youth D identified Former Staff 2 as the newly hired
staff in this incident based on the description Youth D provided to
Vista Representative and Vista Representative showing Youth D a
human resource picture of the staff.
Former Staff 2 (FS2) was interviewed on 04/09/2025 by phone.
FS2 stated she resigned from Vista Maria in 03/2025. FS2 stated
she recalled Youth A and Youth D. FS2 stated she did not
incorrectly dispense medication to Youth A and Youth D. FS2
explained the medication process of right youth, right medication,
right dose and right route at the right time.
Youth B and Youth C were interviewed separately on 03/04/2025
at Vista Maria. Youth B and Youth C stated they do not have
medication dispensing concerns.
Documentation
There are no incident reports for Youth A or Youth D about a
medication dispensing error according to Vista Representative.
Youth A and Youth D’s medication exception (errors, refusals etc.)
records were reviewed for 12/2024 and 01/2025. Youth A does
not have any medication error documented. Youth B does not
have any medication error documented. Youth B does have
numerous morning medication refusals. Former Staff is not
identified in any of the medical exception entries.
Former Staff 2 was never disciplined for medication dispensing.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as there is not enough
supporting information (lack of incident report and medication
8

exception documentation and FS2 denying medication error) to
determine that Youth D’s medication and fiber cookies were given
to Youth A on a morning in 12/2024 or 01/2025.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Immunizations.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4146
Section (1) A resident shall have current immunizations as required by the
Description department of community health.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff have given youth at the facility immunizations without
consent.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 03/05/2025 by phone.
Youth A was interviewed on 03/04/2025 at Vista Maria. Youth A
stated she received a Meningitis vaccine in 02/2025 and her
mother does not want her to receive vaccinations.
Youth A’s Mother was interviewed on 03/05/2025 by phone.
Youth A’s Mother stated Youth A was given a Meningitis vaccine
without her consent. Youth A’s Mother stated she did not know the
medical consent she signed for Youth A included vaccinations but
recently wrote a letter to Vista Maria that precludes further
vaccinations for her daughter.
Documentation
10/07/2024 Youth A’s Mother signed Vista Maria’s medical
consent form. It states “I consent to Vista Maria … providing the
above named client with all necessary medical/mental
health/emergency treatment/services, medications; and to
otherwise do all things necessary to protect their health as Vista
Maria physicians, nurses, therapists, and other treatment staff
prescribe or recommend …”
02/20/2025 Vista Maria nursing progress note states a meeting
was held with Youth A’s Mother and Youth A’s Worker about
vaccinations. Youth A’s Mother voiced her desire for Youth A not
to be vaccinated. The nurse requested Youth A’s Mother provide a
written request.
9

02/2025 Youth A’s Mother wrote a letter dated by month and year
that Youth A is not to receive vaccinations at Vista Maria.
Youth A’s immunization record shows she received
Meningococcal B on 02/06/2025.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance for administering
Meningococcal B vaccine to Youth A on 02/06/2025 based on
Youth A’s Mother signing consent for medical treatment on
10/07/2024. Youth A’s Mother did not provide written request for
Youth A not to receive vaccinations until on or after 02/20/2025.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Revision of Vista Maria’s consent for medical treatment form is
needed. The current wording in the consent for medical treatment
of “all necessary” and “do all things necessary to protect their
health” does not clearly identify vaccinations. Revision or creation
of a form that clearly specifies which vaccinations are authorized
is needed.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There is an unknown male staff member speaking aggressively
and inappropriately to the female youth about other female youth.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 03/05/2025 by phone.
Complainant stated a male staff made an inappropriate comment
about a youth’s body.
10

Youth A, Youth B and Youth C were interviewed separately on
03/04/2025 at Vista Maria. Youth A, Youth B and Youth C stated
they do not have concerns with male staff making aggressive
comments or inappropriate comments about a person’s body.
This allegation is not further investigated because Youth A, Youth
B and Youth C do not have concerns and another Department of
Child Welfare Licensing Consultant investigated a similar
allegation in 2025SIC0000337 without findings.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance because Youth A, Youth B and
Youth C did not express concerns with male staff speaking
aggressively and inappropriately about a person’s body. Also,
2025SIC0000337 has a similar allegation that resulted in no
findings.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention;
Title prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Rule Code & R 400.4159 (1) A child caring institution, including private secure
Section juvenile justice facilities, shall establish a process improvement
Description and restraint reduction/elimination plan that: (d) Staff must
complete refresher training annually or more frequently as
needed.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Investigation Documentation
Vista Maria utilizes Crisis Prevention Institute (CPI) – Nonviolent
Crisis Prevention Intervention. Team Lead 2 had CPI training on
03/16/2023 and was not retrained in 2024. Team Lead 2 was
retrained on 03/25/2025.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance because Team Lead 2 did
not complete annual physical management training in 2024.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
11

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the
current license status be continued.
